availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James C. Culton (Harlan County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Harlan County, Kentucky farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Marinda Culton. Father of A.Y. Culton, Martha Culton, and Jefferson Culton. Farmer in Harlan County, Kentucky in 1860. Served in the 7th Kentucky Volunteers (U.S.A.) as Sergeant and Lieutenant from to September 30, 1864. Employed Zilpha Rice as a domestic laborer in Harlan County, Kentucky in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harlan County, p. 352.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 482.
